chunks.title: Inline & Block Elements in HTML
chunks.text: It is very important to learn the concept of inline and block elements in HTML

chunks.title: Inline & Block Elements in HTML
chunks.text: Inline elements are those which take only the required width

chunks.title: Inline & Block Elements in HTML
chunks.text: and block elements are those which take the entire width of the screen

chunks.title: Inline & Block Elements in HTML
chunks.text: This is also called display property which can be set through CSS

chunks.text: If you are enjoying this video then please like this video

text: It is very important to learn the concept of inline and block elements in HTML Inline elements are those which take only the required width and block elements are those which take the entire width of the screen This is also called display property which can be set through CSS If you are enjoying this video then please like this video So let's go to the computer screen and see inline and block elements closely Through some very good examples Let's roll the intro So guys, it's time to see inline and block elements If you haven't accessed the playlist and code then you can access both Because as the videos are being made, the code of the videos is being added to the playlist Now what I will do here is I will create a folder called video8 I have already added 7 videos here I will create a video8 and open it in VS Code After opening the VS Code, I will get you guys to create an index.html And I will tell you about index and block elements So I typed in an exclamation mark and I could have typed this too But I won't because I can't type this And I will write here inline and block elements I have told you guys a little bit about this But I will tell you guys in detail about inline elements and why I want to use them So inline elements are those which take only the required width Don't block elements take the same width as inline elements? No, they say that they need the full width Some people are like that, they just spread and spread I will tell you guys the difference And to explain this difference, I will cheat a little bit And the cheating is that I will add CSS You might think that I haven't studied CSS, why am I adding CSS? I am adding CSS as much as it is necessary And here I will just do one thing I will write here P and enter And I will write here let us say hey I am a para And I will tell here to give background color to P Let us say blue I will give a nice color here You guys can choose a good color Now you can see here I have given a color to paragraph And along with that I will add an anchor tag href is equal to Google.com let us say And I will have to add HTTPS Then it will go to Google.com And I will write here Google And I will give the background color of anchor tag I will give background color red But not red, I will do hover And this way I can choose any color in the spectrum How did you like Ninja Tagging? Let me know in the comment section below If you already knew about Ninja Tagging, then comment I am already a ninja So you must comment here, it is very important Now you can see here I have given the background color of anchor tag And I have made it very similar I will change it a little bit, I will make it reddish I have made it a little red orange And this is blue Now you see the difference I will click here and as soon as I click here You see that the background color that he got He got it all the way But he got only as much as this element Why did this happen? This is because this is the paragraph block element And our anchor tag is the inline element Inline elements only take the same place as they want Block elements take the full width And the next content that comes is below them When we take the full width, the next content will come below them Along with that, if I talk about div What is that? A block element I am a block element And span is there Which is exactly like div But it is an inline element I am span and I am inline And after this, if I put an anchor tag And write yes he is inline So you see here See what happened Let me show you the code by zooming out So if I write it in a new line By the way, let me tell you how many spaces I give here This will not be added in my content Because HTML is more than one space It does not include it anyway If you want to give spaces Then you can either write ampersand nbsp I will tell you about it But now I want to show you how it works So see what happened I wrote here that I am a paragraph What is paragraph? A block element So he took the full width The next content will come below Ahref is equal to this So he took only the width as much as it is necessary And he took only this much width But the next content was saying that I need the full width So it will not come here It will come in the next line Because it says that I need the full width So it will come in the next line It cannot come in this line Because if it comes in this line, how will it take the full width? Google is also taking the width So it will take the full width If I give it a background color Then I will have to see it in full width Let me give it a yellow color Give it a background color And I give the background color yellow And you see here This yellow took the full width Along with that, I can keep the span and anchor tag in one line Because it is an inline element So it takes the same width as it is necessary And gives the opportunity to come to other elements in its own width As you have seen here This span also gave the opportunity to come to anchor tag Now will the anchor tag always be inline? Will the paragraph track always be blocked? Will this always happen? The answer is no You can change You can set the display property of any particular element from CSS And if you have set the display property Then it is not necessary that it will be inline It can also be blocked And the block element will be blocked It can also be inline We will see this in CSS later Now I would like to pinpoint something quickly That the forms video was video 7 But I have put it in the folder named video 6 So I will make it video 7 And now it is video 8 What we are doing now is video 8 And there is nothing in video 7 So I will quickly structure it here Don't worry about it I hope you are getting good learnings Many people have pointed this in the comments I will fix it But I think that doesn't affect us in any way Because you are understanding it And now the folder of that div is block and span is inline So this comes with practice But I have made a comprehensive list for you Of inline and block elements Here is the list of block elements In which I have written
